Earth Day 1970 I was just about to graduate High School.

It is interesting thinking back at the propaganda that was put forth in the guise of engagement. As a gullible young man I bought into it 100%.

Somewhere around 32 I came to realize those little engagements were agenda driven drivel. All movements target the youth as they have not lived long enough to understand that many are misled or agenda driven. The other odd thing about all those engagements was they always tended to be on the pessimistic side. Of course it's easy to be pessimistic.

My parents never talked to us about these types of things so me and my siblings were a bit unprepared to say the least. If you are old enough to know then you know in the 60’s & 70’s the attempts to “engage the youth” were rife on all sides. There was much open talk of molding our youth. It is tough to do as few remained molded as the engagers envisioned.

My offspring and my sibling’s offspring are far more aware than me and my siblings were. After our young mass media onslaught we learned that there was a need to teach them to be skeptical of those that would seek to engage them.

I know skeptical on this forum is a derogatory term but the opposite is gullible. I think you will find the bulk of today’s youth much less gullible.

Perhaps you should concentrate more on us that are getting older as our mental capacities fade me may be more gullible and easier to engage. We will certainly be more receptive to dooms day scenarios as we will be facing them head on.

Not sure about anyone else but I was bullet proof when young. I wanted everything to be fair because it wasn’t clear that can never be the case, for instance. There are of course countless other examples of the workings of our young minds. One of the ones that I have the fondest memories of is LBJ’s Great Society to eliminate poverty in our time. The reason is that I was exposing the virtues of this to my dad. He gave me that look that always said “you haven’t thought this through”. Being older and wiser though he didn’t try and explain it to me instead he made the comment “son some people want to be poor”. Needless to say I didn’t buy that but it made me think. Guess you could say he engaged me. So in the end of that process I realized that it was his way of letting me discover for myself that you cannot drive other people to success. That’s up to them.

One last question before I check out of this discussion,

Since when did anyone deny climate change?

No Libertarinans that I know of deny that the climate changes, no scientists do, the Neocon's don't, the traditional conservatives do not deny it. Socialists dont deny it, Democrats don't deny it, even the Tea Party people do not deny the fact that the climate chanages.

So please stop the whole denier thing as, it is built on the lie and false premise that anyone who does not believe humans are the #1 cause of this chang means they do not belive the climate changes. This is beyond absurd as everyone know the climate changes and no one has denied that, in fact we see it every day of our lives and it is 100% natural.

On the other hand, so called hoaxers claim that the hypothesis of Anthropogenic global warming as the leading driver of this change ammounts to scientific fact. Last time I checked a hypothesis does not make science or fact. This is why you are rightfully called hoaxers, you go about claiming that a hypothesis = science. Anyone who daydreamed through high school chemistry class can tell you that is not true.

I will close by once more pointing to the facts! While it is fact, there is a conscensus that climate changes, there is not a conscensus to what degree anthropogenic activity has on that change. To date, there is no credible study and no emperical data that has proven the hypothesis that anthropogenic warming is the leading cause of climate change.

Those are simply the unbiased facts no one can deny !

To Jeff (716)

You are right; I don't believe I was harmed directly by what Goldman is alleged to have done.

In the last six months, there have been two large-scale drug raids in my small city. I was not harmed directly by the (more than 40) drug dealers.

There were seven murders last year in my small city. I was not harmed directly by the murderers.

There were two - surprisingly, only two - bank robberies in my small city last year. I was not harmed directly by the robbers.

So I am ignorant and jealous of the drug dealers, murderers and robbers who harmed my city, my country, and my fellow citizens - but not me directly?

So what's your point, Jeff? Why would you defend Goldman, not on the premise that it is innocent of wrongdoing but that it is a victim of posters here who weren't directly harmed? What's in that for you, Jeff?

Can someone please tell me what EXACTLY Goldman did wrong? They were allowed to package and resell their subprime mortgage holdings (god knows everyone else was doing the same thing). It's a terrible risk management decision, yes. But why is everyone getting mad at them. Is everyone here a private or institutional client of GS? If not, how in the world did they hurt you?? They didn't cause your house to depreciate in value! They didn't rip you off.

What they did is realize that there was information asymmetry and opportunities for arbitrage. Goldman was smart enough to understand what they were buying and selling. The institutional clients who bought the CDOs didn't do their research and strictly trusted the AAA ratings, and were outsmarted by Goldman. The facts were there in plain sight. Each MBS tells you the risk profile of the underling mortgage portfolio. If you didn't know exactly what you were buying and didn't know the risks it posed to your fund, then you shouldn't be in the business.
